hero.title: How the Internet Changed Life in Pakistan
hero.subhead: From livelihoods to learning, the web reshaped work, culture and civic life.

metrics.title: Digital footprint at a glance
metrics.lead: Adoption and usage continue to scale nationwide.

pillars.title: Four domains of impact
pillars.lead: Economy, education, culture and governance saw the largest shifts.

items.title: Economy & Work
items.description: E-commerce, gig income and export services created new paths into the global market.

items.title: Education & Skills
items.description: LMS platforms, MOOCs and blended models broadened access to learning.

items.title: Culture & Community
items.description: Social platforms amplified local voices, music and film; diaspora links deepened.

items.title: Civic Life & Services
items.description: E-government, utility apps and tele-health cut friction for everyday tasks.

items.title: Inclusion & Access
items.description: Mobile-first access pulled millions online; affordability and literacy remain key.

items.title: Safety & Rights
items.description: Digital rights advocacy responded to privacy, security and expression concerns.

cases.title: Snapshots & case studies
cases.lead: Real examples across cities, sectors and platforms.

items.title: Freelance boom across second‑tier cities
items.summary: Low entry costs + platforms created remote earning for designers, devs and translators beyond major hubs.

items.title: Ed‑tech for underserved learners
items.summary: Recorded lessons, WhatsApp micro‑learning and LMS pilots helped students bridge gaps during outages and closures.

items.title: Small merchants go online
items.summary: Marketplaces and POS apps enabled payments, inventory and delivery without heavy capex.

quote.text: The internet has become the new oxygen for Pakistan's youth, breathing life into dreams and possibilities.

cta.copy: Explore how spectrum, fiber and rights frameworks can unlock the next decade of growth.
